The Power BI Full Course 2025 by Simplilearn starts with an introduction to Power BI, covering its fundamentals and a beginner-friendly tutorial. It explores business intelligence concepts, dashboard creation, and data visualization techniques. Learners will dive into data transformation, star schema modeling, and Microsoft Power Query for efficient data handling. The course also integrates ChatGPT with Excel for analytics, EDA with Python, and AI-powered insights in Power BI. Advanced topics include Power Automate, career paths for data analysts, and key business analytics skills. Finally, it wraps up with Power BI interview questions, a comparison of Data Science vs Data Analytics, and essential BI terms.

Following are the topics covered in the Power BI Full Course 2025:

title: A Beginners Guide To The Data Analysis Process
description:
üì≤ Curious about a career in Data Analytics? Book a call with a program advisor: https://bit.ly/47LEBk3 

What is the data analysis process? What steps are involved, and how do they relate to the wider discipline of data analytics? In this video, we‚Äôll give you a step-by-step guide to the process, detailing each stage and where it fits into a data analyst‚Äôs work!

Like any scientific discipline, data analysis follows a rigorous step-by-step process. Each stage requires different skills and know-how. To get meaningful insights, though, it‚Äôs important to understand the process as a whole. An underlying framework is invaluable for producing results that stand up to scrutiny.

In this video, we‚Äôll explore and break down the main steps in the data analysis process. This will cover how to define your goal, collect data, and carry out an analysis. We‚Äôll also use examples and highlight a few tools to make this process easier. This video will equip you with a much better understanding of the basics behind the data analysis process. 

For a deeper dive on the data analysis process, you can check out CareerFoundry‚Äôs detailed article here: https://bit.ly/TheDataAnalysisProcess 

Interested in getting started in data analytics? We also have a fantastic, free short course, to help give you a flavor of what it‚Äôs like to work in the field. Sign up here: https://bit.ly/GetStartedInDataAnalytics

The Advanced Excel Full Course 2025 is a comprehensive guide designed for aspiring data analysts and Excel power users. It starts with an introduction to Data Analytics, covering key industry insights and steps to become a data analyst in 2025. Learners are introduced to Microsoft Excel, followed by essential topics like the top 10 important Excel formulas and Excel for Data Analytics. The course also includes Excel Dashboard Tutorials, Power Pivot, and Microsoft Power Query to enhance data manipulation and visualization skills. Advanced concepts like Descriptive Statistics using Excel, ANOVA, and Web Scraping in Excel are also covered, enabling users to handle complex datasets efficiently. Additionally, it explores how to leverage AI in data analytics, including ChatGPT with Excel and Python in Excel, providing automation and advanced analytical capabilities. Career-oriented sections discuss the top 10 data analyst certifications, strategies to make money with Excel, and Excel interview questions to prepare learners for job roles. By the end of this course, participants will have mastered Excel‚Äôs advanced functionalities, empowering them to analyze data, automate tasks, and enhance business intelligence workflows. 

Following are the topics covered in the Advanced Excel Full Course 2025:

title: What do data analysts DO?! Here's a project walkthrough for an entry level data analyst! This goes b
description:
What do data analysts DO?! Here's a project walkthrough for an entry level data analyst! This goes by fast because we're on tiktok, it's okay if you need to pause or rewatch for it to make sense. Any data analytics project essentially boils down to: 1. Locate the data using SQL 2. Select the data using SQL 3. Visualize the data using Tableau 4. Explain the results via email, in a PowerPoint, in a meeting... whatever works for that particular project. For all my recommended resources on how to learn this for FREE, start my free course! ü•∞
